synergynet3

Class SynergyNetApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • synergynet3.SynergyNetApp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMultiplicityApp, IMediaSearcher, IScreenShotter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EarlyYearsApp, FlickGameApp, FlickStudyApp, MuseumApp, MysteriesApp, NumberNet, TestVideoApp, TrackedApp

    public abstract class SynergyNetApp
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMultiplicityApp, IScreenShotter, IMediaSearcher
    Class to be extended by all applications which wish to utilise SynergyNet 3's database, network flick, screenshot, audio playback, media detection and student menu systems.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SynergyNetPosition localDevicePosition
      The position of the current device's interface in its physical environment.
      static boolean MEDIA_SEARCH
      If set to false no threads for searching identified drives will be started.
      static boolean networkFlickEnabled
      Indicates whether items on the display can be transmitted to other tables through the network flick feature.
      static boolean NETWORKING
      If set to false no calls to SynergyNetCluster will be made, allowing for apps to be used without OpenFire running.
      static boolean ONE_MEDIA_AT_A_TIME
      If set to true only one piece of media will be able play at a time.
      static AppSystemSync sync
      Manages network cluster listeners.

      SynergyNetApp()

        Initiates the screenshot renderer to capture an image of the current environment and call utiliseScreenshot with the image file it creates.
        Parameters:
        loc - Location at which the screenshot created should appear.
        rot - Rotation at which the screenshot created should appear.

        Disables network flick listeners from initiating a transfer.

      • enableNetworkFlick

        public void enableNetworkFlick()
        Initiates the announcement to the network that it is now accepting items from network flicks. Enables network flick listeners from initiating a transfer.

        Returns:

      • login

        public StudentMenu login(java.lang.String studentID)
        Will log in a student with the supplied ID. When a student is logged in their representation is retrieved from the database service using their ID and a menu for the student is created and positioned randomly in the environment. When a student logs in their personal gallery is also created and populated using details from their database entry.
        Parameters:
        studentID - ID of the student to be logged in.
        Returns:
        The student menu item created for the corresponding student.

      • loginAll

        public void loginAll(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> IDs)
        Adds a list of student IDs to the start up roster. When a SynergyNetApp extending application starts up it will login all students current on the roster.
        Parameters:
        IDs - Array of the student IDs.

      • logout

        public void logout(java.lang.String studentID)
        Logs out a specific student from the environment and removes their menu. When logging out their details, such as items and feedback stored in their personal gallery, are updated in the database.
        Parameters:
        studentID - ID of the student to be logged out.

      • logoutAll

        public void logoutAll()
        Logs out all students in the environment and removes their menus.

      • logoutAllOfClass

        public void logoutAllOfClass(java.lang.String className)
        Logs out all students belonging to a specific class.
        Parameters:
        className - Name of the class for which all students belonging to it should be logged out.

      • modifyMenus

        public void modifyMenus(StudentMenu menu)
                 throws ContentTypeNotBoundException
        Can be overridden by applications extending SynergyNetApp to modify the options made available by student menus.
        Throws:
        ContentTypeNotBoundException

        Actions to be performed when the SynergyNetApp window is closed.
        Specified by:

      • onFind

        public void onFind(java.io.File[] files)
        Called by the media searching threads when images or audio recordings are found on removable devices or the device's corresponding cache folder. Items for each discovered files are created. If the items are not already present they are passed on.
        Specified by:
        onFind in interface IMediaSearcher
        Parameters:
        files - The files discovered to be used in the app if not already present.

      • onFlickArrival

        public void onFlickArrival(FlickMessage message)
        Retrieves details from the supplied message to recreate the flicked item and to ensure it appears onscreen in the manner expected, i.e. aligning with its flick vector from its source device.
        Parameters:
        message - Structured message detailing the details of an item's arrival.

      • reloadRemovableMediaCache

        public void reloadRemovableMediaCache()
        Forces media searching threads to recreate items for any previously discovered image or audio files found on any removable media drives.

      • reloadServerCache

        public void reloadServerCache()
        Forces media searching threads to recreate items for any previously discovered image or audio files found on the current device's corresponding cache folder.

      • removeAdditionalMedia

        public void removeAdditionalMedia()
        Removes any items which are not part of the current application from the environment.

      • removeVirtualTable

        public void removeVirtualTable(SynergyNetPosition message)
        Removes a device which should no longer be accessible.
        Parameters:
        message - Structured message detailing the device representation to be removed.

      • sendContentsToProjectors

        public void sendContentsToProjectors(java.lang.String[] projectorsToSendTo)
        Send current contents of the app to a the list of projectors provided. * @param projectorsToSendTo List of projectors identities to send contents to.

      • sendScreenShotToProjectors

        public void sendScreenShotToProjectors(java.lang.String[] projectorsToSendTo)
        Send screenshot of current contents of the app to a the list of projectors provided. * @param projectorsToSendTo List of projectors identities to send screenshots to.

      • shouldStart

        public void shouldStart(MultiTouchInputComponent input,
               IQueueOwner iqo)
        Executed at the start of each application which extended the SynergyNetApp. This method first tidies any unused files from the synergynet cache. The method then sets up the default feedback types to be used in SynergyNetApps and records the display dimensions. The screen capture function is then initialised and login menus are created for any waiting students. Following this the controller which listens for appropriate changes in the HazelCast Cluster is initialised. The application's main environment construction is then called and finally the media searching threads are started.
        Specified by:
        shouldStart in interface IMultiplicityApp
        Parameters:
        input - The multi-touch input providing component.
        iqo - Queue owner.

      • shouldStop

        public void shouldStop()
        Called when a SynergyNetApp extending application is closed through traditional means. All students present art logged out, the media searches are stopped and the table announces its removal to the network. Any unused files are then removed from the cache.
        Specified by:
        shouldStop in interface IMultiplicityApp

      • toggleFreeze

        public void toggleFreeze()
        Adds or removes the blue item to represent a frozen workspace.

      • updateVirtualTable

        public void updateVirtualTable(SynergyNetPosition message)
        Retrieves details from the supplied message to create a virtual representation of the device of screen in relation to its real life position. This virtual device can then be used to detect when a flicked item should be transferred.
        Parameters:
        message - Structured message detailing a device's position.

      • utiliseScreenshot

        public void utiliseScreenshot(java.io.File screenShotFile,
                     com.jme3.math.Vector2f loc,
                     float rot)
        Creates a manipulable screenshot item using an image file and adds it to the environment. The screenshot item is registered as feedback eligible and made capable of being network flicked when created.
        Specified by:
        utiliseScreenshot in interface IScreenShotter
        Parameters:
        screenShotFile - Image file to create the screenshot item from.
        loc - Location at which the screenshot created should appear.
        rot - Rotation at which the screenshot created should appear.
